p: ADE may occur when antibodies to the virus fail to efficiently neutralize the virus. Previous studies showed that the binding of virions to non-neutralizing or sub-neutralizing antibodies could lead to more efficient viral uptake into the target cell in FcÎ³ receptor or through complement-mediated mechanisms, leading to enhanced viral replication [ 32 33]. ADE has been reported for various viral diseases including dengue, Zika, influenza, and respiratory syncytial virus infection. The ADE phenomenon has been demonstrated for SARS-CoV-1 using in vitro and animal models [ 34]. However, to date, there has been no evidence of ADE in reported cases and clinical trials on coronaviruses [ 7 20 21 22 23 28].
